content: F.Parisi-Presicce Welcome: this is the homepage of Francesco Parisi-Presicce Professor Dipartimento di Informatica Sapienza UniversitÃ  di Roma ROMA, Italy 00198 E-mail: parisi (at di [firstdot uniroma1 [anotherdot it Phone:     +39 06 49918512 Office:   Via Salaria 113, third floor, room 342 Research Interests Security: Formal Methods, Access Control and Software Vulnerabilities - link Software Engineering and Visual Modeling Techniques - link Graph Grammars and Transformation Systems - link Research Publications by Millenium This Millenium Last Millenium Brief Bio "Professore Ordinario" (Professor)  since Oct 1987 (until Oct 1993 at Univ. L'Aquila) Assistant Professor, Univ. of Southern California, 1981-1987 Ph.D. in Mathematics in 1981 Recent Professional Activities Founding (now Emeritus)  Member of the IFIP Working Group  1.3 Foundations of Systems Specification (current) Member of the Steering Committee of: International Conference on Graph Transformation ICGT Member of the (current or recent) Program Committee of: Italian Conference on Cybersecurity ITA-SEC 2020   ITA-SEC 2019 11th International Conference on Graph Transformation ICGT 2018 ( 2017 - 2016 - 2015 (Co-Chair) - 2014 - 2012 - 2010 - 2008 ) co-chair Doctoral Symposium at STAF 2016 DS@STAF16 11thWorkshop on Graph Transformations and Visual Modeling Techniques GTVMT 2012 ( 2011 - 2010 ) More Program Committees Teaching (some of these pages are in Italian) 2020-2021 Security in Software Applications (Master of Science in Computer Science and MSc in Cybersecurity) Sicurezza (Triennale in italiano) Ingegneria del Software      (Triennale in italiano) 2019-2020 Security in Software Applications      (Master of Science in Computer Science and MSc in Cybersecurity) Sicurezza (Triennale) 2018-2019 Security in Software Applications (Master of Science in Computer Science and MSc in Cybersecurity) Sicurezza (Triennale in italiano) 2017-2018 Security in Software Applications (Master of Science in Computer Science and MSc in Cybersecurity) Sicurezza (Triennale in italiano) 2016-2017 Security in Software Applications (Master of Science in Computer Science) Sicurezza (Triennale in italiano) Earlier Teaching Recent European Projects European Community RTN network 2-2001-00346 SegraVis (Syntactic and Semantic Integration of Visual Modeling Techniques) Team Leader at Univ.
